ratings.comment: Professor Kelly loves what she does. One thing I've learned over this semester is that you HAVE to apply yourself to the class if you wanna see the results. For me, the weekly quizzes and homework were difficult and long. Also, I didn't attend 30% of the lectures. At the end of the day, she cares about her students. I would take this class again.

Professor Kelly truly wants what is best for her students. Econ is a difficult class no matter what professor you have. She has an entire website of old tests, quizzes and homework problems that she grants you access to at the beginning of the semester. She also uploads recap videos about each topic covered in class! I hope she enjoys retirement :)

Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. She relates a lot of the content to real life examples which genuinely help you conceptualize the material. Lots of homework and reading, but reading isn't essential if you go to lecture and the homework doesn't count for much, but if you do it you'll do better on exams. Highly recommend for 101.

AMAZING PROF! She is such a fantastic lecturer, and perfectly explains topics. I wish I could take more classes with her, she truly cares about her students. Super friendly and accessible for office hours! Her exams are fair, there are tons of great resources. I wish her all the best, and hope she enjoys retirement!

I love economics, but she made me hate it so much. She expects students to attend all lectures, read upwards of 50 pages per module, watch hours of lecture videos, and do lengthy homeworks on top of that. The thing that bothered me the most about her was it seemed like she wanted to confuse you. If you want to not hate econ do not take 101 with her
Absolutely do not take this course

Literal hell. She makes this class so difficult. She writes at the speed of light and goes so fast through the math and ACTUAL learning but then spends so long on irrelevant life stories. I could tell you more about her life than about economics. I did everything she said to do, but the tests, quizzes, and homework is so difficult.

Kelly is truly amazing. Her lectures are always fun to attend because she explains them really well and provides real world examples and experiecnes. She takes the time to make sure her students understands the material. The exams are pretty tough but I enjoyed the lectures too much to drop it :)

Professor Kelly isn't the BEST at Madison but I did enjoy her class. The workload was really heavy at the beginning and middle of the semester but the end is pretty light. Lectures were all pre recorded but the discussions were live but optional since she records them. She always asks for feedback as she genuinely cares how we feel about the class

I came into this class as an econ major and after taking her class, immediately started to search for other majors. Her lectures were bad and she made the class so math heavy that exams weren't focused on the content and theory as much as math and equations. To top it off, final grade was .08% away from an A and she wouldn't round it up. rip gpa

Professor Kelly has the most ridiculous expectations of students I have encountered at college. Taking this class online there were 3 hours of lecture a week, 4+ hours of lecture videos a week, homeworks take forever, weekly quizzes are hard, and exams are harder. If you could can get any other professor for Econ 101 I would highly recommend it.

Professor Kelly is a very sweet lady who is very knowledgeable on the subject of economics. Grade is based around 5 bigger homework assignments, 10 lecture quizzes, 2 midterms, and 1 final. This class is not easy A, and you will be forced to work hard. But, you will learn a lot from this class, so if you are majoring in economics take this course.
You will have to work hard but Kelly is a sweetheart that genuinely wants her students to succeed.

This class made Van Vleck Calculus seem like a tropical paradise. If you can avoid getting Professor Kelly, do it. Tests are ridiculously hard, lectures are half stories, half mindless practice problems, and if you miss lecture you will struggle. Has the expectations of a 10 credit course. The readings are not worth it, lecture reiterates info.
she is an amazing teacher, reallly brout out the best in me

I absolutely loved Professor Kelly's class! She made herself super available outside of class which was so nice and she's really great at getting back to you on email! The tests are super hard- all multiple choice with both math and conceptual aspects needed for all questions. Nothing was mandatory but reading before lecture was super helpful!

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. Its obvious that she has used the same examples her whole career so she speeds through her content in lecture and then doesn't put in the time to post the lectures online. Furthermore she teaches the class as if its the only class her students are taking. Absurd expectations for an entry level class.

The homework is easy enough, but the exams are ridiculously difficult. She teaches you in lecture the bones of micro, but then on the exam, she texts you on every single organ and vessel. A lot of the learning I did for the exam was on my own from her old practice exams. Friends help.

Although Professor Kelly's ECON111 class wasn't easy and lectures are basically mandatory, she explains concepts well and keeps lectures interesting. She also sends out extra practice problems after lectures and has her website for all previous exams. She is a kind hearted person and is always available to help students.
Her lectures are not what is on the test, however, they are interesting.

Her test have nothing to do with her lecture material at all- lectures are somewhat interesting, but all that is tested on in the class is your ability to connect the concepts to math- a very frusturating and not well thought-out curriculum and class
Bad Professor.

There're many people that don't like Professor Kelly, but it REALLY depends on your learning style. She lectures every class, but gives really good real world examples. I found her to be one of the most caring professors if you get to know her. The more time you spend paying attention/reviewing, the better grade you will get. DO THE PRACTICE TESTS!

Lectures are disorganized as she consistently goes on tangents about herself . Exams are made to intentionally trick you, make sure you do the homework problems as that will keep you from failing the class and make sure to go to every single lecture because if you miss just one you will show up the next time and not know what is going on

Professor Kelly is a very fast moving professor. If you don't go to lectures or if you even miss one lecture, you will be extremely lost in the class. I personally had a difficult time with this class as it was mostly math based rather than concept based.

This was more of a math class than an econ class. The exams were designed to trick you instead of testing econ knowledge. She called out the lowest score on one of the exams in front of the lecture and told them they would have gotten a better grade if they just rolled a dice.

If you have the opportunity to NOT have Kelly, take it. Class is extremely test-heavy and they are very difficult. Homeworks can take forever and the concepts in lecture/discussion are much more simple than on the exams. Curve at the end is what will save you.

I love professor Kelly. She has a lot of experience. Econ is not that hard as it looks, especially if you have even a little knowledge about math. It just needs some time and effort. I did not skip a single lecture or discussion and advice you to do the same. Extremely generous curve. Make sure to visit office hours because you are gonna love her!

Kelly is a great professor & really knows her stuff. You learn a lot if you pay attention & if you put in the time and practice, you'll do well. Her class is curved so the top 20% of the class gets an A, next 20% an AB, etc. Her exams are pretty fair you just have to work fast to get it done. You can get 90% of relevant info w/o reading textbook

Really sweet and wants her students to do well. That being said, her tests never reflect what is on the homework or what we learn in class. Most of the material covered is math based and not conceptual. She makes the exams way too long for the time allotted, thus the averages for each exam are incredibly low (usually around 55%).

If you are good at math and quick at algebra then this class will be fine. You're basically just taking areas and drawing graphs the whole time. I definitely didn't learn anything about economics, but I am great at graphs now (LOL). Lectures made your hand hurt because she wrote so fast but I was always able to use the notes to help me study.

The exams seemed almost intended to trick you. The average scores were ridiculously low every time. I put in a lot of outside work to this class and yet, still didn't do the best. Hard to keep up when taking notes as she goes SO fast! Very math heavy, more of a math class than an econ class.

Prof Kelly is an amazing person. You might not understand a thing in lecture attend every class to take notes! DON'T MISS DISCUSSION, it helps you understand stuff better. Go meet her because she is the nicest person ever and gives you great life advice. This class is hard work but put in some effort and you will do well. Hard examgenerous curve!!
Literally the worst class I have ever taken. It was a requirement, but if you have no econ background from high school goodluck

Terrible professor. I got trapped into thinking I could do well because of the first two weeks being ridiculously simple material. Her lectures are stupidly fast-paced and if you even blink you missed a chapter's worth of material. She goes on tangents about her self which ruins the flow of class, and she basically teaches math instead of econ. RIP
This class was a breeze. Literally did nothing, went to lecture one time, showed up for the three tests, and did better on this course than any other course Ive ever had before.

She's terrible. Don't take her. I got like a 60% overall in the class and ended with a B because the curve was so low. She told us if we did her practice problems and went in for help, we'd pass with ease yet I don't know a single person who actually did good on the exams. The homework is basically completion so that's easy but they're only 2 pts.

Contrary to what people say, I really enjoyed econ 101 with Kelly. Go to lecture, do the homework she gives, and know how to do the problems and you're good. It's more math based and you don't have to read the textbook. Do the practice exams on her website before exams and you will be good.
Nice prof!!!!!!!
Exam questions are made almost specifically to trick you.
Made an already difficult 101 much harder than necessary

This class is more work than most, but if you put in the time it will pay off. The readings can get long but are definitely worth it. Kelly and all of her TAs have lots of office hours to get extra help when you need it too. Your final grade is 10% homework, 25% each midterm, & 40% final so make sure you are confident going into the exams.

She is energetic in lectures and takes notes in real time so students can take notes with her. For Econ 101 she is more math-heavy than other professors. She goes over math/graph examples in class and moves on. Be prepared to put in a lot of time after class to understand her examples and concepts. Most people would rather have a different prof.

I rarely go to the lecture and still get an A. The discussion handouts and practice questions are helpful and enough for self-study. There's a textbook but I never use it. Past exams on the website are SO HELPFUL! Be sure to go through five years past exams. No practice final but it's easier than midterms. Only five hw, not grade on correctness.
Kelly was absolutely the worst professor I've ever had in my entire life. Not flexible with grades and exams barely cover class material. DO NOT TAKE WITH KELLY.

Professor Kelly is a good professor but I think a lot of people don't understand her lectures are only beneficial if you read the chapter (most people don't read). I read all the chapters, went to her office hours, went to lectures and did practice problems occasionally. This class with Kelly makes you a better thinker.

Not sure what went wrong. I did practice problems, went in for help, & studied 40+ hours for the final, still got a 58. I found that other professors had actual review packets & weekly quizzes which would've helped see if you're learning and also cushion your grade. She's a nice lady , but she's not a good professor. Her examples are not relevant.
Would have dropped this course if it wasnt required for my undergrad. If you need thorough examples and reasoning behind econ concepts, try to get a different econ 101 professor.

I really would have preferred to have a different professor, something with me did just not click with Professor kelly. If you are not responsibly doing her practice problems every night of the week like she recommends, or are already taking a heavy math class, maybe skip this one till later. I wish she would have had weekly discussion quizzes

If you're not strong in math it may be more difficult. Prof. Kelly is a good person and does provide examples/goes over the material in order, but she goes off on a lot of tangents that take up example time so she will rush through the numeric examples. Also the midterms are hard and worth a lot. There's no way to raise your grade if you bomb one.

If you don't have a strong math background, I would not recommend taking econ with Professor Kelly. The exams can be really tough and there is no homework to balance out your grade. Also, she doesn't post her notes online so you have to go to lecture to learn anything.
Great economics professor. I took intro to micro and macro with her. If you want to major in economics or business I would suggest taking her class.

She's a decent professor. her examples are sometimes redundant, which results in not being able to cover all the material. What really irked me was that HW was often on topics we didn't cover in class until after the HW was due. Otherwise, she has a great sense of humor and lectures are pretty good. Do the HW and do really well on the easy first MT

Not even coming from the perspective of someone who failed the class (finished with an AB), Professor Kelly is legitimately the worst professor I've ever had. Your entire grade is based on 3 completely unfair, extremely difficult exams, and 5 2-point homework assignments she says are "extra credit". Do not take econ101 with kelly for any reason.

While I don't necessarily agree with her teaching style, Professor Kelly is a person who truly cares about her students. When I was sick and was falling behind in her class, she helped me come up with alternatives so that I wouldn't tank my grade in her class. She will go out of her way to help you if she thinks you are a hard worker and care.

Kelly isn't awful, but she is definitely the least preferred Econ teacher. Very math based and lecture heavy, do not skip class. Tests are pretty hard as well. Lectures are informational but the examples are basic compared to what you are expected to do on a test. Also gets off track easily.

Professor Kelly is a great teacher of economics and she has her ways of making content interesting. That being said the class is paced very fast and you must be willing to put in the time to get that A.

Professor Kelly is a really great person and she definitely tries to make class interesting. However, she moves VERY fast in lecture, and the exams can be tough if you're not well prepared. My advice is to do practice problems often and go to office hours if you have questions-she's really good at explaining.
Extremely memorization heavy especially when it comes to equations. Lectures are usually somewhat enjoyable. She always has stories that help make things more fun. Tests are pretty difficult.

Professor Kelly's lectures can make sense at times, but they are overall extremely confusing. Perhaps what makes this class the worst though is the fact that your grade is determined not by your understanding of economics, but your ability to grasp math. By far the worst class and professor I've had in my time at UW so far.

Jeez. This is as much an Algebra class as it is an Econ class. Lectures are straightforward and make sense, but tests take the material to a whole new level. On these two midterms and final, she dishes out ugly numbers and bizarre scenarios. You can understand the economics and still fail every exam. This class requires daily practice.

Personally, I enjoyed Professor Kelly and would take another class with her. I think her teaching style is understandable and concrete. I do think it is important to have the right TA, but all of them are accessible yours doesn't work for you. I think you need to have an acquired taste to like Kelly, and I guess I was one of them that liked her.

Absolutely awful professor. Main message: you will fail this course if you skip Kelly's lectures; however, you will be lucky to get a BC if you do go to her lectures. She flies threw relevant material and spends hours on irrelevant material. When she does actually teach, she doesn't teach economics, she teaches math. Stay far away!

I really don't like this class at all. It's too math based and Kelly's lectures are boring and confusing. Discussion is kinda helpful though. She does post old exams online, and taking those before the midterms are your best bet for success. Take Econ 101 with Johnson if at all possible.

Worst teacher ever. So frustrating. Goes way way way way too fast in lecture. DO NOT TAKE. Absolutely terrible. She talks about random things and teaches the material terribly. Almost impossible to do well in her class. Beware.
Terrible professor, would get on many tangents during lectures and went way too fast on important things. Don't take her at all costs. Test was unreasonably hard.

Was hesitant to have Kelly after reading reviews, but she really isn't that bad. She will go on tangents in lecture, but it is important to come. Discussion is optional and not that important as long as you are doing practice problems. Getting up at 8am for a better professor isn't worth it for this class. Go to lecture and do practice problems A

Professor Kelly is a great person. She is accessible to every student after class, but there seems to be not many students actually went to her office hour. Her classes do have strong emphasis on math. However, if you have been trained by the relatively math heavy courses, such as math 222 and physics 201, you will be totally fine in her classes.

Three days before our final exam, Kelly was much of the last third of material on the exam. This also happened before both midterms. If she didn't spend half of the class time talking about unrelated topics, we would have learned far more. I found the set up of this class to make it difficult for those not gifted in math to succeed.

Kelly is a sweet person but her teaching style is a bit estranged. If you're a person who can stay awake during direct long lectures, then this might the right professor for you! But honestly, this class was so difficult and it killed me because I could not understand anything. There are no chances to bring your grade up and you just snowball down

Kelly is by far the worst professor Ive had. She makes long winded examples about herself and rushes through real material. Her tests are full of trick questions and ridiculous mental math, instead of economic theory. Ive been a straight A student up until this class. Average on the final was a 67

The class is very math based so if you want to focus on the topics take the class with another professor. If you aren't normally an A student don't expect to get an A in this class. You don't need the book and all of the tests come directly from lecture and discussion. Do plenty of practice exams before the real tests.

Kelly has been by least favorite professor at Madison by far. I was able to easily get an A in Econ 101, but this class way harder. Kelly make you do insane division and math on her tests. I would never take a class with her again. She wastes time in lecture, and goes really fast when she actually gets to the things that matter.

Take this class if you want to learn nothing about MacroEconomics and instead figure out how to do algebra with absurd numbers without using a calculator on the tests. Nothing you learn in class applies to the tests (90% of your grade is determined on 3 tests.) If you are actually interested in macroeconomics, take a different professor.

Prof. Kelly is a great lecturer and is very engaging with the class. Unfortunately, the class is very math-based and requires a lot of practice to do well. The midterms are very hard and the 5 homeworks are tedious and take a long time to complete. This class could really use another weekly discussion section, one was not enough.

Professor Kelly is really great and caring about students if you meet her personally outside the classes. She lets students view economics in another way. If you are good at math, this class is easy to go. The concepts here are not so hard. Its more about math.

Professor Kelly's class is hard. At least that's what most of my friends said. However, they didn't attend lectures so that's probably why it was hard. Also, go to office hours she's a really good professor who cares about her students. The stories she tells explain econ in a different way and if you think they're boring you're missing the point.

If you aren't doing 20+ hours of work for this class a week(not leading up to exam) you will do poorly. Lectures are dull and an unprecedented amount of writing. Plus 90% of her teaching is based in graphs which is annoying to say the least

Slept in the 1st row for 50% of her classes; she's only interesting when she talks about real-world economic policy. Don't buy the textbook, write down the examples she does in class and practice problems from old tests. Exams are extremely difficult but since its all math oriented the least you can do is practice and time yourself.
Worst class I've taken at the university.

The homework and discussion sheets are really easy, then the midterm will have problems with huge-ass numbers so you spend a ton of time doing math instead of actually showing you understand the concepts. The midterms are much harder than the homework just by virtue of the numbers being huge. So just be prepared for that.

Professor Kelly isn't for everyone--she's an excellent professor for those willing to put forth effort and work for it. Her econ class is more math based, so for those who are weaker in math, perhaps try to have a different professor. She grades on a curve: the top 20% receive and A and down the line. She is a tad difficult, but fair.

I would have given her a higher rating if her lectures weren't so boring. I had taken an economics course before, and I enjoyed it, but Professor Kelly made economics sooo uninteresting. If you take econ101, take it with Johnson, I heard he is a great teacher.

An average professor. Her bad rep is because of her tests. If you're good with quick math and logic, and have an overall understanding of the class, tests aren't too bad. Highly recommend looking at previous tests she posts online as test Q's are different from lecture. Lectures are boring and the first 2 weeks she doesn't even mention econ.

If you are conservative, good luck getting through the lectures. She adds in many unnecessary comments about her political beliefs which gets very frustrating. However, if you do manage to get through the lectures and do your homework you should do fine in the class.

Kelly gets a bad rep but if you actually apply yourself there's no reason you can't do well in this class, although the exams are hard there is a very generous curve. If you do the online problems, go to class, read the book, and work hard to learn the material you can get a good grade. Exams are very math heavy!!

Professor Kelly is a very a good lecturer! Her classes are full of interesting real life examples that explain the ideas clearly. The only thing is that you have to copy every note down, because she will not post notes online and the exams are based heavily on notes. So you have to focus and sometimes it gets exhausted when copying the notes!

Professor Kelly is not as bad as everyone on here says she is. Unlike most professors, she actually creates the lectures as you go which helps alot. Also, if you go to her office hours she is very helpful and actually pretty nice. Yes, she does go off on personal tangents, but everything on the test is based off lecture so it doesn't really matter.
Horrible
Inefficient

I echo all of the latest comments. Avoid Professor Kelly if you can!! I learned nothing in this class except Kelly's personal political views which she always tries to convince you are the right way to think. Her lectures are messy and unclear yet her tests are extremely difficult and mostly math based. Worst Professor I've had here at UW.

Good lecturer. She goes at a pretty quick pace but it is doable. Spent a little too much time in the beginning of the fall semester going over unnecessary stuff like how college is hard. Occasionally goes off on political tangents but in general is a great lecturer. Would recommend for Econ.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. I went to every lecture and they were the most pointless thing. She spent way too much time going over silly examples that were often times about herself, and sped through the actual topic examples and failed to explain her work. She is extremely condescending and unapproachable. Avoid her at all costs!

This is honestly the hardest class I have ever taken. I went to every lecture and every discussion and barely passed the class. Her lectures are a waste of time and she takes forever on pointless examples. Her homework takes hours, is super hard, and you receive no feedback on your work. If you have her, switch out and find a new teacher.

She is the worst professor I have ever had. Wastes all of class time talking about nonsense. Then at the end of the semester she speeds through everything we need to know. Tests are very hard and have nothing to do with the book. Avoid this lady at ALL costs.

Kelly will spend approximately 5 minutes on the actual class content and then the other 70 minutes on long winded examples (usually about herself) that don't benefit anyone's understanding. She also got pretty behind in my class and had to keep bumping things to the next midterm and then rushed everything at the end. Also be prepared for math!

Professor Kelly is truly passionate about economics which is great, she is a nice person but a poor teacher. During lecture she will rush through the lesson and would always ramble on about her life story and how she got to where she is now. She made Econ 101 so much more difficult than needed to be, I recommend taking the course with someone else.

Her test is really really heavy and you calculate all difficult numbers by hand(not all integrate numbers), the math is triple harder than SAT or ACT, and I get almost perfect scores on them. You need to read the book before or you cannot catch up with her lecture. Lecture always explains theories and discussion is about math problems.

Kelly is an overall nice person and clearly knows her stuff, but her exams are very tough. The class is very math/graph heavy, so if you are good at thinking through tough mathematical situations this class is for you. 90% of grade comes from 2 midterms and final exam. 10% from homework. It is my toughest class this semester, but I do not dread it.

Lectures are boring. Kelly goes off on tangents all the time and she can make an hour long lecture feel like an all day affair. Exams are EXTREMELY math heavy, so make sure you know how to calculate everything by hand, as calculators are not allowed for exams, otherwise your grade will tank as Exams are basically the only thing you'll be graded on
